item.title: 聘用摩根大通日本策略师的地区性银行寻求更多机会
item.description: 日本最大的地区性银行希望聘请专家，帮助其投资风险较高的资产。【原文：Japan’s biggest regional bank wants to hire experts who can help it invest in riskier assets.】

item.title: 市场权衡中美前景分歧，石油走低
item.description: 由于市场权衡了强劲的美国经济数据和伊朗或其代理人袭击以色列的可能性，以及中国乏善可陈的需求前景，石油价格走低。【原文：Oil edged lower as the market weighed strong US economic data and the possibility of an attack by Iran or its proxies on Israel against a lackluster demand outlook in China.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 2024年8月2日，星期五，中国杭州，阿里巴巴集团控股有限公司总部的标牌。阿里巴巴定于 8 月 15 日发布财报。【原文：Signage at the Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. headquarters in Hangzhou, China, on Friday, Aug. 2, 2024. Alibaba is scheduled to release earnings results on Aug. 15.】

item.title: 出口企业走强，日本股市将迎来周线上涨
item.description: 日本股市将迎来一个多月以来的首次周线上涨，基准指数从近期的颓势中逐步回升，原因是美国经济前景向好，日元汇率下跌，为科技公司和出口商提供了支撑。【原文：Japanese stocks are headed for their first weekly advance in over a month, with benchmark indexes gradually recovering from the recent rout amid a better economic outlook in the US and a decline in the yen, which are supporting tech firms and exporters.】

item.title: 印尼 2025 年预算计划贸易商指南
item.description: 印度尼西亚总统佐科-维多多（Joko Widodo）的继任者计划大幅增加支出以促进经济增长，因此印尼的预算可能会使消费、银行和建筑股受益。【原文：Indonesia’s budget may benefit consumer, banking and construction shares as President Joko Widodo’s successor plans to significantly ramp up spending to boost economic growth.】

item.title: 新加坡巨型金属库存引发罕见的仓库争夺战
item.description: 新加坡的金属库存激增，而全球需求放缓只是部分原因。【原文：Metal stockpiles are surging in Singapore, and slowing global demand is only part of the reason.】

item.title: 香港有望在基准指数中加入健康和科技领域的名字
item.description: 香港恒生指数在 5 月份仅纳入一家公司后，在即将进行的季度审查中可能会纳入更多医疗保健、科技和物流行业的股票。【原文：Hong Kong’s Hang Seng Index may add more stocks in health-care, tech and logistics sectors in an upcoming quarterly review after including only one firm in May.】

item.title: 强台风逼近日本 航班和火车中断
item.description: 台风 "安比 "周五逼近日本本州本岛，迫使日本各大航空公司取消航班，政府也发出警告，可能发生山体滑坡和洪水。【原文：Typhoon Ampil edged closer to Japan’s main island of Honshu on Friday, forcing major Japanese airlines to cancel flights and the government to issue warning against possible landslides and flooding.】

item.title: 美国经济衰退担忧减弱，亚洲股市将上涨：市场综述
item.description: 周五，美国强劲的就业和支出数据缓解了市场对经济衰退的担忧，从而推动了股市反弹，并导致债券暴跌，亚洲股市随之上涨。【原文：Equities in Asia were primed for gains Friday after robust US jobs and spending data eased recession concerns, fueling a rally in stocks and sending bonds tumbling.】

item.title: 高盛的柯克认为外国人会在日本股市暴跌后买入日本股票
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Foreign investors are looking to buy Japanese stocks as the market regains its footing after the steepest decline since Black Monday in 1987, said Bruce Kirk, chief Japan equity strategist at Goldman Sachs Group Inc.】

item.title: 市场震荡后交易商国债持有量跃升至创纪录水平
item.description: 一级交易商持有的国债创下历史之最，这表明上周全球风险资产大跌后，投资者纷纷涌入避险资产，资产负债表正在充盈。【原文：Primary dealers hold the most Treasury securities on record, an indication that balance sheets are filling up after a global selloff in risk assets last week sent investors flying into haven assets.】

item.title: 监狱食品供应商 TKC 在行业反弹中重新定价贷款
item.description: 周四，监狱食品供应商 TKC 控股公司（TKC Holdings Inc.【原文：Prison-food vendor TKC Holdings Inc. priced an almost $500 million loan Thursday as investors grow increasingly hesitant to fund companies that profit from mass incarceration.】

item.title: 司法部延长最后期限后阿拉斯加与夏威夷的交易疑虑得以平息
item.description: 交易员们试图计算监管机构的意图，这让夏威夷控股公司（Hawaiian Holdings Inc.【原文：Traders trying to calculate regulators’ intentions have sent shares of Hawaiian Holdings Inc. on a roller coaster ride, but Thursday left them more confident than ever that Alaska Air Group Inc.’s $1.9 billion plan to buy the rival airline will go through.】

item.title: 货币市场资产再创新高，系统现金充裕
item.description: 在上周全球风险资产大跌导致投资者纷纷抛售现金之后，货币市场基金资产进一步流向优质资产，从而创下了新的纪录。【原文：Money-market fund assets rose to a fresh record thanks to further flight-to-quality flows after a global selloff in risk assets last week sent investors flying into cash.】

item.title: 劳工部长拒绝干预加拿大铁路争端的呼吁
item.description: 加拿大政府拒绝了加拿大国家铁路公司（Canadian National Railway Co.【原文：The Canadian government has denied an arbitration request by Canadian National Railway Co., increasing the likelihood of a nationwide work stoppage by thousands of its unionized workers.】

item.title: 加拿大最大的养老金公司靠 "无聊 "在债券市场上节省开支
item.description: 加拿大最大的养老基金找到了降低借贷成本的制胜法宝：提高可预测性。【原文：Canada’s largest pension fund has found a winning formula to cut its borrowing costs: be more predictable.】

item.title: 锁定协议终止，美航股价下跌 50
item.description: 因巨额会计欺诈而陷入破产保护的巴西零售商 Americanas SA，在债务重组后对大多数债权人的禁售期结束后，股价出现下滑。【原文：Americanas SA, the Brazilian retailer that was rocked by a massive accounting fraud and sunk into bankruptcy protection, saw its shares slump after a lock-up period ended for most creditors following its debt restructuring.】

item.title: 穆迪和 S&P 可能因 Kellanova 交易下调玛氏信用评级
item.description: 穆迪评级公司（Moody's Ratings）和S&P全球评级公司（S&P Global Ratings）可能会降低玛氏公司（Mars Inc.【原文：Moody’s Ratings and S&P Global Ratings may slash Mars Inc.’s credit grades after the candy maker agreed to buy Kellanova for about $36 billion, including debt.】

item.title: 摩根大通称逢低买进公司债券70%可获回报
item.description: 摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：It usually pays to buy US corporate bonds when the market weakens, according to a research note from JPMorgan Chase & Co.】

item.title: 华尔街刚刚拥有了最不稳定的 ETF，风险押注蓬勃发展
item.description: 美国交易所交易基金市场以风险越来越高的产品而闻名，在这个市场中，有一种新产品在众多产品中脱颖而出。【原文：In a part of the US market for exchange-traded funds that has become known for increasingly risky products, a new offering has debuted that stands out in the crowd.】

item.title: Omers 受益于信贷和美元，上半年回报率达 4.4
item.description: 安大略市政雇员退休系统上半年的回报率为 4.4%，主要得益于股票、私人信贷和对美元的投资。【原文：The Ontario Municipal Employees Retirement System posted a 4.4% return in the first half, boosted by stocks, private credit and exposure to the US greenback.】

item.title: 由 CIM 支持的亚特兰大市中心改造项目将开拓公交市场
item.description: CIM 集团的一家附属公司正在利用市政债券市场为一项耗资 42 亿美元的大型开发项目融资，该项目旨在将亚特兰大市中心的一个地段从停车场改造成公寓和商店。【原文：A CIM Group affiliate is tapping the municipal-bond market to help finance a $4.2 billion megadevelopment intended to transform a downtown section of Atlanta from parking lots into apartments and shops.】

item.title: 石油钻井商博尔认为浅水钻机即将退役
item.description: 海上石油承包商 Borr Drilling Ltd. 预计，在未来几年内，全球近三分之一的浅水钻井平台将因老化而退役，从而导致日租赁费上涨。【原文：Offshore oil contractor Borr Drilling Ltd. expects almost a third of the world’s fleet of shallow-water rigs to be retired in the coming years because of their age, leading to higher daily leasing rates.】

item.title: 白宫发言人达列普-辛格谈经济与国家安全的关系
item.description:
为什么白宫现在如此重视破冰活动

Why the White House is now so focused on Icebreakers

】

item.title: 量化基金有望在股市掀起现金浪潮
item.description: 科威德-19疫情以来美国股市最大规模的平仓已经结束，现在追随趋势的量化基金准备重返股市。【原文：The largest unwind in US equities since the Covid-19 pandemic is over, and now trend-following quant funds are ready to return to the stock market.】

item.title: 尽管市场平静，德意志银行首席信息官仍敦促进行尾部风险对冲
item.description: 随着美国股市本周恢复攀升，华尔街又恢复了平静，但德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）表示，投资者仍需为自己的投资组合做好准备，以应对未来资产的剧烈波动。【原文：Calm has been restored to Wall Street as US stocks resumed their climb this week but Deutsche Bank AG says investors still need to gird their portfolios against future wild asset swings.】

item.title: 股价暴跌期间，高盛回购柜台涌入创纪录订单
item.description: 上周，美国股市陷入 10 月份以来最严重的调整，美国企业也是大跌买入者之一。【原文：Count corporate America as one of the big dip-buyers last week as US stocks fell into their worst correction since October.】

item.title: 机构需求增长，更多对冲基金购买比特币 ETF
item.description: 对冲基金、养老金和银行继续向直接投资于比特币的交易所交易基金投入大量资金，因为更多的传统投资者开始接受这一资产类别，美国监管机构在年初勉为其难地帮助将其推向主流。【原文：Hedge funds, pensions and banks continued to lavish capital into exchange-traded funds that invest directly in Bitcoin, as more traditional investors embrace the asset class that US regulators begrudgingly helped push into the mainstream at the beginning of the year.】

item.title: 美国抵押贷款利率自七月底以来首次上升
item.description: 美国抵押贷款利率三周来首次攀升。【原文：US mortgage rates climbed for the first time in three weeks.】

item.title: 卢拉警告马杜罗巴西与委内瑞拉的关系正在恶化
item.description: 巴西总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva）说，尼古拉斯-马杜罗欠全世界一个关于委内瑞拉大选的解释，目前关于大选结果的争议已经导致巴西利亚和加拉加斯之间的关系恶化。【原文：Brazil’s Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva said Nicolas Maduro owes the world an explanation about what happened in Venezuela’s election, and that the ongoing dispute over the outcome has caused relations between Brasilia and Caracas to deteriorate.】
